Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class TGame
extends Object
implements Serializable
    TombolaGame class is a funny piece of code, where a Tombola game match can be simulated, monitored, controlled and analyzed. I like it very much! It is another piece of magic for me!
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Harry G. Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
    See Also:
    TCard, TSacchetto, TAward, TAwardList, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int DEFAULT_SUPERBOMBOLA  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TGame​(String id)
      Quick constructor that requires just an id String to give an identifiable name to your TGame object. The id is also used as descriptive name (label) for the game. See TGame(String, String)
      TGame​(String id, String label)
      Main constructor for TGame object. All you need to specify is an id that will help to identify this specific game, and a label, possibly with a more descriptive or funny name. A brand new TGame object is in 'Initializing' state and all components needed to start a game MUST be created apart and specified using proper setter methods: a sacchetto, a list of gaming cards, a tabellone, the list of available awards and a logger.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addLateCard​(TCard newCard)
      !!!STILL NOT IMPLEMENTED!!! Allow to add a card late after the game as been already started, recovering all numbers previously extracted.
      TGameResultCode assign()
      After each number extraction, if setConfirmCandidateOn(boolean) is set to true, you need to call this method to assign award to candidate cards.
      int confirmCandidate​(TCard card)
      When setConfirmCandidateOn(boolean) is set to true, all cards that are candidate to be appointed an award after a number extraction require explicit (manual) confirmation or deny. This method allows the TombolaLib client user to confirm that the card passed as input parameter can contend the award (or directly win it, if it is the lone candidate card).
      int confirmCandidate​(List<TCard> cards)
      Allows to confirm more than a card simultaneously. See confirmCandidate(TCard) for further details.
      int denyCandidate​(TCard card)
      Delete the card passed as input parameter from the 'waiting for confirmation' list of an award, so preventing the card could win the award.
      int denyCandidate​(List<TCard> cards)
      Allows to deny more than a card simultaneously. See denyCandidate(TCard) for further details.
      TGameResultCode extractNumber()
      This method acts just like extractNumber(int) but does not require the extracted number as external input, providing automatically to extract a random number that has not already been extracted before.
      TGameResultCode extractNumber​(int number)
      You can consider this method as the "prince" of all TGame methods! It executes all the logic and controls to simulate and manage the consequences of the extraction of a number during a tombola game. It requires as an external input the number to be extracted (of course, it must be a valid number that has not been already extracted before) and checks all cards participating to the game against the available awards to verify if...
      TAwardList getAwards()
      Return the complete list of award objects currently used by this game. It will contain all prizes, both already assigned and still to be appointed.
      TCardList getCards()
      Return the card list object containing all the cards participating to the game.
      int[][] getConflictVector()
      Deprecated.
      long getElapsedTime()
      Return the elapsed time, in milliseconds, since the beginning of this tombola game. If the game hasn't already been started, this method raise a runtime exception. If the game has already finished, this method returns the duration of the game.
      long getEndTimestamp()
      Return the timestamp (a long value indicating the standard 'system time') of the ending moment of the game.
      int getExtractionCount()
      Return the counter for extracted tombola number during the game.
      TAward getFirstAwardToResolve()
      When, during the tombola game, an award is contended by more than one card, that is, the game is paused in status "RESOLVING", this method returns the first award object within the ordered award list that have many contending cards.
      String getId()
      Return the name that identify this specific tombola game object.
      boolean getJollyOn()
      Return true if jolly numbers are considered 'special' and highlighted in log messages during the game, false if they are ignored, that is considered as any other normal number on cards.
      String getLabel()
      Return the descriptive, possibly funny, name for this game object.
      int getLastExtracted()
      Return the last number extracted from the TSacchetto associated to this game.
      int getLastMatchingCount()
      Return the number of cards that have matched the last number extracted.
      TGameResultCode getLastResultCode()
      Return the resultCode reached by the last call to extractNumber(), extractNumber(int), resolveCandidates(int), resolveCandidates(int[]) or rollback() methods.
      ITLogger getLogger()
      Return the ITLogger interface implementing object associated to this game.
      TSacchetto getSacchetto()
      Return the sacchetto object (the cloth sack) associated to this game.
      long getStartTimestamp()
      Return the timestamp (a long value indicating the standard 'system time') of the beginning of the game.
      TGameStatus getStatus()
      Return the current status of this tombola object (see TGameStatus)
      TCardList getTabellone()
      Return a list of card object containing the six "special" cards forming the tombola billboard associated to this game.
      int[][] getWinVector()
      Deprecated.
      TGameResultCode resolveCandidates​(int winnerPos)
      This method is a syntactic sugar method and acts just like resolveCandidates(int[]), but allows to specify just a single, unique winner card for the first award that is in "CONTENDING" status. See the cited companion method for further details.
      TGameResultCode resolveCandidates​(int[] winnerIndexes)
      When, after the extraction of a number, more than one card reach the score to be appointed to an available award, the game "pauses", enters the "RESOLVING" status and requires that someone, from the external, make a choice and resolves the conflicts. This method helps to manage this very common situation, letting the user to adopt whatever criteria she/he wants to take the choice and thus communicating it to the TGame object by means of this method.
      TGameResultCode rollback()
      This method, as you can imagine, allows the rollback of the last extracted number during a tombola game. Perhaps it requires to be checked, tested and fixed a bit...
      void setAwards​(TAwardList awards)
      Set the (previously prepared, see TAwardList) list of awards that will be available during the game. As usual, even this setter method can be invoked only during the INITIALIZING status of the tombola game object.
      void setCards​(TCardList cards)
      Set the list containing all the cards that will be used during the tombola game. TCardList objects can be prepared starting from TSeriesList objects, that are usually used to store and load series of cards to and from files.
      void setConfirmCandidateOn​(boolean confirmCandidateOn)
      When set to true (default is false), this parameter stops the evaluation process executed after each number extraction and allows the user to explicitly accept or deny cards that have reached the score for an available award. So, for example, it is possible to exclude (deny) a card if the player do not claim her/his award.
      void setJollyOn​(boolean useJolly)
      Set the flag indicating if jolly numbers configured on cards must be considered when playing the game.
      void setLogger​(ITLogger logger)
      Set the logger object that will be used to spool all relevant messages regarding the status of the game.
      void setSacchetto​(TSacchetto sacchetto)
      Set the sacchetto object (that is, the cloth sack) used to draw numbers during the tombola game.  This method must be invoked only when the TGame object is in 'Initializing' status, that is before a match has been started (the first number has been extracted). Besides, the sacchetto object must be fresh new and contain all 90 numbers.
      void setTabellone​(TCardList tabellone)
      Associate to this TGame instance the six special cards forming the tombola billboard (i.e. the 'tabellone'). They to not participate to award assignment, unless they are included in the TCardList object passed using the setCards(TCardList) method, but are equally updated at each extraction, so they can be used to display the game status.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • TGame

        public TGame​(String id,
             String label)
        Main constructor for TGame object. All you need to specify is an id that will help to identify this specific game, and a label, possibly with a more descriptive or funny name. A brand new TGame object is in 'Initializing' state and all components needed to start a game MUST be created apart and specified using proper setter methods: a sacchetto, a list of gaming cards, a tabellone, the list of available awards and a logger.
        Parameters:
        id - a name to identify this specific tombola game.
        label - a more descriptive or funny name for the tombola game

      • setTabellone

        public void setTabellone​(TCardList tabellone)
        Associate to this TGame instance the six special cards forming the tombola billboard (i.e. the 'tabellone'). They to not participate to award assignment, unless they are included in the TCardList object passed using the setCards(TCardList) method, but are equally updated at each extraction, so they can be used to display the game status.
        Parameters:
        tabellone - a TCardList object containing the special six cards of a tombola billboard. They must be six and of TBillboardCard subclass of TCard

      • setSacchetto

        public void setSacchetto​(TSacchetto sacchetto)
        Set the sacchetto object (that is, the cloth sack) used to draw numbers during the tombola game.  This method must be invoked only when the TGame object is in 'Initializing' status, that is before a match has been started (the first number has been extracted). Besides, the sacchetto object must be fresh new and contain all 90 numbers.
        Parameters:
        sacchetto - A brand new sacchetto, containing all 90 numbers to play.
        See Also:
        TSacchetto

      • getTabellone

        public TCardList getTabellone()
        Return a list of card object containing the six "special" cards forming the tombola billboard associated to this game. The bill board is automatically created during the initialization phase, when a sacchetto object is set for the game.
        Returns:
        the list of six billboard cards associated to this game
        See Also:
        TBillboardCard.getWholeBillboard(String)

      • setLogger

        public void setLogger​(ITLogger logger)
        Set the logger object that will be used to spool all relevant messages regarding the status of the game. It MUST be set during the initialization phase of the game and cannot be changed after the first number has been already extracted. See ITLogger and TSimpleLogger to check all possibilities you have to catch tombola game messages or to define your custom logger to spool messages in the way you prefer (on files, on databases, etc.).
        Parameters:
        logger - the logger object that will be used during the game to spool all relevant game messages

        Return the ITLogger interface implementing object associated to this game.
        Returns:
        the ITLogger interface implementing object associated to this game.
        See Also:
        setLogger(ITLogger)

      • setJollyOn

        public void setJollyOn​(boolean useJolly)
        Set the flag indicating if jolly numbers configured on cards must be considered when playing the game.
        Parameters:
        useJolly - true to let this TGame object consider the jolly numbers on cards, false to ignore them (that is considering them as any other number on cards)

      • getJollyOn

        public boolean getJollyOn()
        Return true if jolly numbers are considered 'special' and highlighted in log messages during the game, false if they are ignored, that is considered as any other normal number on cards.

        if jolly numbers are considered 'special' or not.

      • setConfirmCandidateOn

        public void setConfirmCandidateOn​(boolean confirmCandidateOn)
                           throws TTombolaRuntimeException
        When set to true (default is false), this parameter stops the evaluation process executed after each number extraction and allows the user to explicitly accept or deny cards that have reached the score for an available award. So, for example, it is possible to exclude (deny) a card if the player do not claim her/his award.
        Parameters:
        confirmCandidateOn - true to allow for explicit confirmation of all cards candidate to win an award after a number extraction, false to let TGame object to proceed automatically considering all cards that have reached proper score.
        Throws:
        TTombolaRuntimeException
        See Also:
        assign(), confirmCandidate(TCard), denyCandidate(TCard)

        the elapsed time, in milliseconds, since the beginning of this tombola game.
        Throws:
        TTombolaRuntimeException
        See Also:

      • getWinVector

        @Deprecated
public int[][] getWinVector()
        Deprecated.
        As the game proceeds, winVector stores the extraction count at which each award category is won. Example: winVector[0][7] will contain 1 if the Ambo has been won at the seventh extraction, etc. It is used for data analysis and statistics purposes.
        Returns:
        A 'data analysis purpose' matrix filled during the game. Each element [award_category-2][i] contains zero if after the i-th extraction no award has been won, 1 if the award has been won (sixth row of the matrix contains 1 for tombola).

      • getConflictVector

        @Deprecated
public int[][] getConflictVector()
        Deprecated.
        Used to do statistical analysis on tombola games. Return an int matrix containing, at position [i][j] the number of conflicts for prize of value j at i-th extraction.
        Returns:
        an int matrix containing, at position [i][j] the number of conflicts for prize of value j at i-th extraction.

      • getExtractionCount

        public int getExtractionCount()
        Return the counter for extracted tombola number during the game. Its value is 0 (zero) if the game is not started jet, a positive value indicating how many numbers have already been extracted from eh ballot box.
        Returns:
        the current count of already extracted numbers from the ballot box.

      • extractNumber

        public TGameResultCode extractNumber()
        This method acts just like extractNumber(int) but does not require the extracted number as external input, providing automatically to extract a random number that has not already been extracted before.
        Returns:
        a TGameResultCode indicating the status of the game after the extraction and the next action to perform to properly continue the game.
        See Also:
        TTombolaExamples, TGameResultCode, TGameStatus

      • extractNumber

        public TGameResultCode extractNumber​(int number)
        You can consider this method as the "prince" of all TGame methods! It executes all the logic and controls to simulate and manage the consequences of the extraction of a number during a tombola game. It requires as an external input the number to be extracted (of course, it must be a valid number that has not been already extracted before) and checks all cards participating to the game against the available awards to verify if...
        1. there is a new award winner (for example, a card that get "TERNO")
        2. there two or more cards reaching the same award score, thus "contending it" and requiring a following resolveCandidates(int) or resolveCandidates(int[]) call
        3. there is a card winning the last available award, typically a Tombola, thus bringing the gate to its conclusion
        All relevant events are properly logged on the ITLogger object set for the game.

        Finally, the methods return a TGameResultCode indicating the "consequences" of this extraction and therefore communicating to client code which is the correct next action to perform and continue appropriately the game.

        Please, find an example of the typical workflow needed to manage a complete Tombola match within the TTombolaExamples class.

        Parameters:
        number - the number just extracted: of course, it must be a valid number that has not been already extracted before.
        Returns:
        a TGameResultCode indicating the status of the game after the extraction and the next action to perform to properly continue the game.
        See Also:
        TTombolaExamples, TGameResultCode, TGameStatus

      • confirmCandidate

        public int confirmCandidate​(TCard card)
        When setConfirmCandidateOn(boolean) is set to true, all cards that are candidate to be appointed an award after a number extraction require explicit (manual) confirmation or deny. This method allows the TombolaLib client user to confirm that the card passed as input parameter can contend the award (or directly win it, if it is the lone candidate card).
        Parameters:
        card - the candidate card to be confirmed
        Returns:
        1 if the card has been confirmed, 0 otherwise (the card passed as input parameter is not in the current award 'wait for confirmation' list)
        See Also:
        setConfirmCandidateOn(boolean), assign()

      • confirmCandidate

        public int confirmCandidate​(List<TCard> cards)
        Allows to confirm more than a card simultaneously. See confirmCandidate(TCard) for further details.
        Parameters:
        cards - the candidate cards to be confirmed
        Returns:
        the number of cards that have been effectively confirmed (cards passed as input parameter must be in the current award 'wait for confirmation' list)
        See Also:
        confirmCandidate(TCard), setConfirmCandidateOn(boolean), assign()

      • denyCandidate

        public int denyCandidate​(TCard card)
        Delete the card passed as input parameter from the 'waiting for confirmation' list of an award, so preventing the card could win the award.
        Parameters:
        card - The card to be denied
        Returns:
        1 if the card has been effectively denied, 0 otherwise (the card passed as input parameter is not in the current award 'wait for confirmation' list)
        See Also:
        confirmCandidate(TCard), setConfirmCandidateOn(boolean), assign()

      • denyCandidate

        public int denyCandidate​(List<TCard> cards)
        Allows to deny more than a card simultaneously. See denyCandidate(TCard) for further details.
        Parameters:
        cards - the candidate cards to be denied
        Returns:
        the number of cards that have been effectively denied (cards passed as input parameter must be in the current award 'wait for confirmation' list)
        See Also:
        confirmCandidate(TCard), denyCandidate(TCard), setConfirmCandidateOn(boolean), assign()

      • assign

        public TGameResultCode assign()
        After each number extraction, if setConfirmCandidateOn(boolean) is set to true, you need to call this method to assign award to candidate cards. *
        Returns:
        a TGameResultCode indicating the status of the game as well as the next action to perform to properly continue the game.

      • getFirstAwardToResolve

        public TAward getFirstAwardToResolve()
        When, during the tombola game, an award is contended by more than one card, that is, the game is paused in status "RESOLVING", this method returns the first award object within the ordered award list that have many contending cards.
        Returns:
        the first award object having more than one card contenting for it.
        See Also:
        TTombolaExamples

      • resolveCandidates

        public TGameResultCode resolveCandidates​(int winnerPos)
        This method is a syntactic sugar method and acts just like resolveCandidates(int[]), but allows to specify just a single, unique winner card for the first award that is in "CONTENDING" status. See the cited companion method for further details.
        Parameters:
        winnerPos - the index (i.e. the position) of the card you want to be the unique winner of the first award in "CONTENDED" status (see also getFirstAwardToResolve()).
        Returns:
        the status of the game object after the contention has been resolved, just like the status returned by a extractNumber(int) call. It is also possible that, after the resolution of a contention, the game still remains in "RESOLVING" status just because there are one or more loser that have been shifted to the next award (i.e. a "SECOND TERNO") and another call to resolveCandidates(...) is needed.
        See Also:
        resolveCandidates(int[]), TTombolaExamples

      • resolveCandidates

        public TGameResultCode resolveCandidates​(int[] winnerIndexes)
        When, after the extraction of a number, more than one card reach the score to be appointed to an available award, the game "pauses", enters the "RESOLVING" status and requires that someone, from the external, make a choice and resolves the conflicts. This method helps to manage this very common situation, letting the user to adopt whatever criteria she/he wants to take the choice and thus communicating it to the TGame object by means of this method.
        Parameters:
        winnerIndexes - a int[] vector containing the index/indexes (i.e. the positions) of the card/cards you want to be the unique winner or "ex equo" winners of the first award in "CONTENDED" status (see also getFirstAwardToResolve()).
        Returns:
        the status of the game object after the contention has been resolved, just like the status returned by a extractNumber(int) call. It is also possible that, after the resolution of a contention, the game still remains in "RESOLVING" status just because there are one or more loser that have been shifted to the next award (i.e. a "SECOND TERNO") and another call to resolveCandidates(...) is needed.

      • rollback

        public TGameResultCode rollback()
        This method, as you can imagine, allows the rollback of the last extracted number during a tombola game. Perhaps it requires to be checked, tested and fixed a bit...
        Returns:
        WRONG_NUMBER TGameResultCode value if the call to rollback() is invalid for some reason (no number has been already extracted, or the game is already ended or not in a proper status), NOWINNER is the rollback process "seems" to succeed.

      • getLastResultCode

        public TGameResultCode getLastResultCode()
        Return the resultCode reached by the last call to extractNumber(), extractNumber(int), resolveCandidates(int), resolveCandidates(int[]) or rollback() methods.
        Returns:
        the last resultCode reached by one of the Tombola Game actions methods.
